page.title: 15GLOSSOPDALE TOURISM
page.content: {Glossop Victorian Weekend}is held in mid-September. There are many{ {entertainments}like a{horse drawn {carriage}from the Howard Arms or the {Glossop Old Band}who play in Norfolk Sq. where the{Morris dancers}also provide a colourful display.There are games for children to play -{whip -the {-top,hop scotch,hoop and stick {races.}Policemen,postmen,shopkeepers, and townspeople wear{Victorian costume {and uniforms.}There are contests like the 'strong man' and 'tug-of-war'. {Dinting Railway Centre}occupying a 10 acre site is dedicated to the{active {preservation of steam locomotives.}The engine I liked best was called the{ {Scots Guardsman}which weighs 135 tons. We went in the cab and Mr. Bob Paulden told us all about it and the jobs of the driver and fireman. The Centre also keep other railway equipment.
